Articles.Content: It's something I've been toying around with more now that I'm using Kethane, and since it's handy to have a Kerbal nearby to help it would be nice to have some more variety in their living quarters. So what's everyone's favorite mods for spicing up the Kerbals homes?

Lack Luster Labs, Perfect for more square colony shuttles, Trucks even adds kethane fuel squares for trucks!

Home 1.0.5 But sadly it's outdated and probably never going to be dated, Works in version 0.21.

Sadly they just don't make anymore colony part packs anymore...

Bearsh you need to lurk more on the forums, Ive been using MKS for awhile now and its pretty good probally the best colony mod out at the moment and works great with Kethane and Taclife. All of lacklusters parts are some of the best around and compliment colonization very well but adding in MKS http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/72706-WIP-0-23-5-Modular-Kolonization-System-v0-14-1-(ALPHA)-04-19-2014 you will have a great time.

That was a joke Bearsh, Bearsh go check it out me and my son and really built a lot stuff on the moon and minimus using probally 70 something mods including kethane and Taclife which seems the mod was made for. Its still a work in progress but its fun! here is MKS--http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/72706-WIP-0-23-5-Modular-Kolonization-System-v0-14-1-(ALPHA)-04-19-2014

Plus I included some really cool things to use while using these mods. Universal storage--http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75129-Universal-Storage-%280-23-5%29. And if you use KAS this makes EVA's with the colony mods great but you have to have modulemanager----http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/71683-A-Mechanic-Is-Jeb-or-KAS-For-Almost-Everything

HAVE FUN!!!!
